note.p: Daughter of Archibald Douglas and his wife, Mary Hake; baptised in Islington Lower Street Chapel, Middlesex, 1772. Married Francis Fox of Derby, physician, in Ashbourne, Derbyshire, in 1794. Mother of Douglas and Charles Fox. Lived in Derby in her widowhood.
Census returns of England and Wales, 1851 (The National Archives: Public Record Office HO107/2143/824/2)
certificate of death, 5 January 1852, St Peter, Derby, Derbyshire (General Register Office, England)
Derbyshire, England, Church of England marriages and banns, 1754–1932 (Ancestry.com, accessed 10 April 2018)
England & Wales, non-conformist and non-parochial registers, 1567–1970 (Ancestry.com, accessed 10 April 2018)
Prerogative Court of Canterbury will registers (The National Archives: Public Record Office PROB 11/1301/301)
